Presenting Problem / Chief Complaint: The patient wishes to explore better handling of disagreements, especially under stress.
History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient acknowledges occasional slips back into old habits during conflicts but emphasizes the importance of awareness and mutual support in recognizing these moments.
Psychosocial History: The patient reports positive developments in their relationship with their daughter and girlfriend, highlighting improved communication and engagement.
Physiological Observations: The patient has been exercising more, which has contributed to feeling more energized and focused.
Progress Evaluation: The patient is making progress in both personal and familial relationships, showing increased openness and willingness to communicate.
Therapeutic Interventions: The patient is exploring strategies for managing stress and improving communication, including taking breaks during conflicts and using a signal phrase.
Next Steps: The patient will continue to focus on the discussed strategies and check in on their effectiveness in the next session.
